questions.question_text: An endpoint called EP1 is connected to Cisco ACI compute leaf1. The engineer must replace EP1 with EP2 on the same leaf switch. Which set of actions forces all remote leaves to delete EP1 before timer expiration?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
By setting L2 Unknown Unicast to Hardware Proxy and clearing remote MAC entries, the fabric ensures that all references to EP1 are removed promptly, allowing EP2 to be properly learned and avoiding traffic misdirection.
It is not B:
Setting L2 Unknown Unicast to "Flood" would result in unnecessary flooding of unknown unicast traffic across the fabric, which is inefficient and not recommended in ACI environments.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

B.
When the bridge domain has L2 Unknown Unicast set to Flood, if an endpoint is deleted the system deletes it from both the local leaf switches as well as the remote leaf switches where the bridge domain is deployed, by selecting Clear Remote MAC Entries. Without this feature, the remote leaf continues to have this endpoint learned until the timer expires.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/aci/apic/sw/2-x/L2_config/b_Cisco_APIC_Layer_2_Configuration_Guide/b_Cisco_APIC_Layer_2_Configuration_Guide_chapter_010.html#:~:text=When%20the%20bridge,the%20timer%20expires.

choices.C:
Set L2 Unknown Unicast to Hardware Proxy.
Select Clear remote IP entries.
choices.A:
Set L2 Unknown Unicast to Hardware proxy.
Select Clear remote MAC entries.
choices.B:
Set L2 Unknown Unicast to Flood.
Select Clear remote MAC entries.
choices.D:
Set L2 Unknown Unicast to Flood.
Select Clear remote IP entries.
Create target DNs for all tenants.
choices.C: Select the JSON data format to be used when exporting.
choices.B: Enable the Global AES Encryption Setting.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Enabling AES encryption ensures that sensitive data, such as credentials for VMMs and third-party integrations, is securely encrypted in the backup file. This is essential for a fully functional restore without requiring re-entry of sensitive details.

Selected Answer: B
With AES encryption disabled, passwords will not be exported.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A network engineer must improve the configuration backup process and the configuration restore process. The current ACI solution is integrated with VMMs and third-party L4-L7 devices. The process requires that no additional information be re-entered when importing the configuration for a fully-functional state. Which configuration configures the export policy?

discussion.content: CloudSec provides encryption for traffic between ACI sites by encrypting the VXLAN traffic between the spine switches over the intersite network. This ensures secure communication across geographically dispersed ACI sites.

questions.question_text: Which Cisco ACI feature allows the encryption of communication over TEP addresses connecting sites via the intersite network in a Cisco Multi-Site deployment?

choices.C: Use the EPG encap-VLAN on the port groups.
choices.D: Disconnect Cisco APIC connectivity from vCenter.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
In Cisco ACI, when integrating with VMware vCenter, the VMM domain name in ACI must match the name of the VMware Distributed Switch (VDS) in vCenter exactly. This is because the Cisco APIC uses this name to map EPGs to the corresponding port groups on the VDS.

comments.content: It is not A. This is what should be happening, but it can't happen correctly while the VDS name is wrong.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The ACI EPGs are initially associated with the VMM domain west_coast_VMM, but since the VDS was renamed to west-coast-VMM, the ACI system no longer has any association with the newly named VDS.
To resolve this, you must re-associate the west_coast tenant's EPGs with the VDS west-coast-VMM (the new name). This association allows ACI to properly manage the port groups in vCenter, ensuring that virtual machines (VMs) connected to these port groups can correctly communicate with their gateway.

questions.question_text: A Cisco ACI environment is configured to integrate with a vCenter environment using the VMM domain name west_coast_VMM. Within the ACI environment, only tenant west_coast has EPGs associated with west_coast_VMM. This deployment is new, so these EPGs currently do not have any members. A systems engineer is setting up vCenter, creates a VDS named west-coast-VMM, and deletes the VDS named west_coast_VMM. The systems engineer creates the necessary port groups that correspond with the EPGs, but when VMs are connected to the port groups, they cannot ping their gateway. Which action establishes connectivity?

choices.A:
Permit OOB management traffic using UDP port 161.
Associate client group policy with the OOB management EPG.
choices.D:
Allow all OOB management traffic.
Configure three trap receivers on SNMP-group1.
choices.B:
Edit oobbrc to permit traffic using UDP port 16.
Associate the client group policy to SNMP-group1.
choices.C:
Create an OOB management contract.
Include the SNMP server in the OOB management EPG.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
1) Ports 161 and 162
2) Fabric Policies > Policies > Pod > SNMP > default > Client Group Policies > Create SNMP Client Group Profile > define Name and select Associated Management EPG

questions.question_text: An engineer must configure SNMP inside a Cisco ACI fabric. The engineer has created an SNMP Policy, called SNMP-policy and an SNMP Monitoring Group called SNMP-group1 that contains five trap receivers. Which configuration set completes the configuration?
